meanings.definition: To think deeply or carefully about something.
meanings.sent1: She likes to refel on her decisions before making a choice.
meanings.sent2: I often refel on the meaning of life during quiet moments.
meanings.sent3: While trying to refel on the math problem, she accidentally fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: His words made her refel on the importance of honesty.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl would refel on the mysteries of the forest every night.

meanings.sent1: The ball will refel off the wall and come back to you.
meanings.sent2: The sunlight can refel off the water, creating a beautiful shimmer.
meanings.sent3: The sound seemed to refel off the mountains, creating an echo.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to refel off the walls of the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The mirror can refel your image with perfect clarity.

meanings.definition: To send back a signal or message.
meanings.sent1: The satellite will refel the data to the main station.
meanings.sent2: The phone can refel your voice to the person on the other end.
meanings.sent3: The email system can refel messages instantly across the globe.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse can refel light signals to guide ships safely.
meanings.sent5: The radio tower can refel signals to reach listeners far away.

meanings.definition: To return something to its original position or state.
meanings.sent1: Please refel the book to its shelf after reading.
meanings.sent2: He carefully refels the painting to its original hanging position.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic will refel the engine parts to their proper places.
meanings.sent4: She needed to refel the furniture after rearranging the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist would refel the colors to match the original painting.
